00019 #ifndef _SimpleBinaryFile_HEADER_
00020 #define _SimpleBinaryFile_HEADER_
00021 
00022 /**
00023  * @file SimpleBinaryFile.h Provides interfaces to create a simple binary file 
00024  *       storing a table of data. 
00025  */
00026 
00027 //
00028 #include <cstring>
00029 #include <fstream>
00030 #include <string>
00031 #include <vector>
00032 //
00033 
00034 /*! Used to create a simple binary file storing a table of data. */
00035 class SimpleBinaryFile
00036 {
00037 public:
00038     /*! Constructor */
00039     SimpleBinaryFile();
00040     
00041     /*! Destructor */
00042     ~SimpleBinaryFile();
00043 
00044     /*! Create a new file.
00045      * @param fileName The file name.
00046      * @return True if created.
00047      */
00048     bool CreateNewFile(const std::string &fileName);
00049 
00050     /*! Write the header
00051      * @param rows The number of rows
00052      * @param cols The number of columns of data (not including the row label.
00053      * @param rowHeaderLabel The label for the row header.
00054      * @param rowHeaderLabelMaxLength The maximum length of the row header values
00055      * @param colIds A unique id for each column
00056      * @param colNames The names of each column
00057      */
00058     void WriteHeader(int rows, int cols, const std::string &rowHeaderLabel, int rowHeaderLabelMaxLength, const std::vector<std::string> &colIds, const std::vector<std::string> &colNames);
00059 
00060     /*! Write a row of data.
00061      * @param rowLabel The label for the row
00062      * @param values The column data
00063      */
00064     void WriteRow(const std::string &rowLabel, const std::vector<float> &values);
00065 
00066     /*! Write a row label.
00067      * @param rowLabel The label for the row
00068      */
00069     void WriteRowLabel(const std::string &rowLabel);
00070 
00071     /*! Write a data point.
00072      * @param data The data to write.
00073      */
00074     void WriteData(float data);
00075 
00076     /*! Close the file and check the status. */
00077     bool Close();
00078 
00079     /*! Update the row count.
00080      * @param fileName The name of the file.
00081      * @param rows The row count.
00082      */
00083     void UpdateRowCount(const std::string &fileName, int rows);
00084 
00085     /*! Open an existing file.
00086      * @param fileName The file name.
00087      * @param rows The number of rows
00088      * @param cols The number of columns of data (not including the row label.
00089      * @param rowHeaderLabel The label for the row header.
00090      * @param colNames The names of each column
00091      * @return True if successful.
00092      */
00093     bool OpenFile(const std::string &fileName, int &rows, int &cols, std::string &rowHeaderLabel, std::vector<std::string> &colNames);
00094 
00095     /*! Read a row of data
00096      * @param row The row index
00097      * @param rowLabel The row label
00098      * @param data The data
00099      */
00100     void ReadRow(int row, std::string &rowLabel, std::vector<float> &data);
00101 
00102 private:
00103     /*! The output stream. */
00104     std::ofstream outFile;
00105 
00106     /*! The input stream. */
00107     std::ifstream inFile;
00108 
00109     /*! The length of the row headers. */
00110     int rowHeaderLength;
00111 
00112     /*! The position where the data starts. */
00113     int dataStartPos;
00114 
00115     /*! The size of each row. */
00116     int rowSize;
00117 };
00118 
00119 #endif
